titleStmt.title: P. F. Hansborough et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG14238

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.idno: Flat Storage Box: 11th Ky Cav (US) Muster Rolls, Bundle 2

body.p: Camp, 11th Ky, Cav. Frankfort, Ky, Oct. 15. 1862

We the undersigned members of Capt. Jas. A. Johnson's Company, ^(Co. B.)^ 11th Ky Cavalry, do petition his Excellency, James F. Robinson, Govenor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, to commission William M. Simpson Supernumerary 2nd Lt. of said company. We take this method of expressing our desire and choice that Said Simpson be invested with said office in said Company.

J J Stone
W C Willhook
Jas Haney
B F Melton
A. M. Stone
J. A. Mornes
George Bolls
E W Vallandingham
W Limbrick
Thos Readenour
J R True
Frank Brown
J J Jump
T Sewards
Sidney. M. Bailey
J N Noe
J A Bard
A Dunn
R Wilson
H Lembroke
A Gray
Ed Gray
James
R
W H Onstat
W H Franks
D Blackburn
Wm M C Foster
W M Holbart
H. C. Hedges
R G. Marks
Joseph McMelton
W Smith
Nehemiah Rozel
Wm. O Banoin
T Hanley
R M Edmonds sr
Wilson May
E F Robinson
W T Arnold
Wm Woodyard
Daniel Ball
T W Page
Wm H Edmonson
A L. Schully
J S Hammons
47 W S Cook
over
2nd Page
W. J. Greene
Jasper Beagle
J B Hendrix

Frankfort Ky. Oct. 17- 1862.
To his Excellency Gov. Robinson:

We, the under signed do certify that the within is the voluntary act of those whose names, appear to petition, including all the members of our company that are now present - twenty five of whom are all detached duty; and that we do recommend and desire that the Said Simpson be invested with that office.

Signed } James A Johnson Capt.
P F Hansbroguh 1st Lieut

11 Cav
Lt. Simpson
Com. issd. Aug 25. 1862
Issue Commission to Mr. Simpson - He was elected and ought to have been mustered before
